title: Chaco Culture National Historical Park: Eating & Sleeping
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Eating & Sleeping             Eating & Sleeping         No Food Available in the park. Clip art  Chaco Culture National Historical Park is very remote and does not have any commercial services. No food is available in the park. If you need fuel or food, you must bring them with you. The convenience store at the junction of Hwy 550 and County road 7900 is the last commercial establishment where you can obtain any supplies you may need.        Camping available in park clip art  The Gallo Campground, located in Chaco Culture National Historical Park, has 49 individual campsites and two group sites. Of these, 41 individual sites and the two group sites are available by reservation.        There is no hotels or motels in the park. clip art  The closest lodging to Chaco Culture National Historical Park is located 1 1/2 hours away.
